old.desc:
This is a complicated.  I want to create an automatic VO2max calculation and it has a lot of calculations.

‌

‌

WARNING: Show below if last 2 weeks have been low intensity focus and previously had more high intensity and the VO2max is dropping.

You may notice a slight dip in your estimate as you focus on base training. This is expected and healthy! You're trading a little top-end sharpness for a much stronger endurance engine, which is the key to reaching higher peaks later. Keep up the great work!

old.desc: Right now taper has no intensity.  We should let taper work the way it works now but insert some intensity up to 4 days in advance, the last 3 days before the event should not have any intensity, so that is days not workouts.

card.desc:
Right now taper has no intensity.  We should let taper work the way it works now but insert some intensity up to 4 days in advance, the last 3 days before the event should not have any intensity, so that is days not workouts.

What you want to do is to find 2 workouts they did last week that had main work intervals > 100% and when  So let’s say last week was Dynamic Force #10.  Take that workout they had schedulede and cut the main work in 1/2 (or approximately 1/2) and inject it after 10 minutes into todays taper workout.  Do the same with a second workout and try to make this on the same days so if last week it was Mon and Wed for these, schedule them this week for mon and wed also as long as that is not 3 or less days from the event.   If it is just inject them into the workout that is 4 or more days from the event and a workout that is 2 or more days before this as long as both of those are taper days.

Now if they don’t have any > 100% workouts.  Just inject 3 intervals of of 120% for 1 minute with 2 minutes rest on the same days above.

It’s possible in some cases you will only get 1 of these intensity main work sections injected.

Here is HR description
Warm-Up 8 min
30 sec \@ Z2 (~104w / ~104bpm)
2:30 min \@ Z3 (~119w / ~119bpm)
8 X (4 min \@ Z5 (~180w / ~180bpm) with 4 min \@ Z1 (~72w / ~72bpm) rest )

It should be something like this.  Provide a range of +5 of - 5
8 min warm-up
30 sec \@ 100 - 110 bpm
2:30 min \@ 113 -123 bpm
8 X (4 min \@ 175-185bpm with 4 min rests)

This is very simplified, remove zones and watts.

- 8 X (4 min \@ 120% (180w) with 4 min \@ 40% (60w) rest )

Should be
Total **1h 15m**

- 8 min warm-up
- 30 sec \@  180w
- 2:30 min \@ 90w
- 8 X (4 min \@ 180w with 4 min rests)

card.desc:
The main thing is if someone pays and has a problem I want to give them a period of not having to pay but then their auto-subscription billing should continue.

See below, seems possible to

1. Cancel subscription (don’t send email
2. Create a manual subscription to cover the gap
3. Create new subscription that starts in the future.

I am ok if it shows 3 subscriptions on page for this but just don’t want user getting a bunch of emails.

card.desc:
Ok so here is what we decided

1. Long term we want to reduce or at least not increase the number of projects
2. Long term - we want to standardize on Typescript for frontend and backend, and VUE3 for front end
3. Medium Term - We are not sure if we are going to be able to turn on vue3/vue2 compatibility but ultimately this would be best.  We will try to do this after billing #1 launches
4. Medium Term - We will try to convert main api to type script or determine how much time that would take
5. Short term
   1. Andrey will rename his routing project to web
   2. Alex will add his billing front end to this web project until we can look at #3 above
6. Short Term - Backend API for routing has it’s own project
7. Short Term - Andrey should rename his python project to python-api and all python code should go into this.  He should structure the project so it is ready for other functionality not related to routing (like my metrics API)

card.desc:
So we are using [authorize.net](http://authorize.net "‌") for billing but they only allow credit card based billing but we can “hack it” so that we add our manual payments.

They take care of all the credit card stuff, customer profiles and automatic subscriptions.  We just need to add these features

1. Create new Customer/Subscription
2. Update Subscription (Yearly>Monthly or Monthy>Yearly) with prorating (we need to figure out how to pro-rate.)
3. Cancel Subscription
4. Create subscription from apple/google.
5. Cancel subscription from apple/google.
6. Expire subscription on failed payments
7. Expire subscription for all manual payments after cancellation (credit card payments this should happen automatically)

‌

So when we have credit card payments we will have subscription records but first we can just look at the customer description to see if it starts with Apple, Google, or Manual.  If it starts with one of those then they are automatically active.  If not we can look at subscription status.  Currently we are looking at the status in Mongo, maybe this is best and we just look at webhooks that update mongo.  If I can go in and just edit a customer in [authorize.net](http://authorize.net "‌") and say “expired” instead of manual, or if I cancel the subscription.  Seems best if I can just do all user managment from a[uthorize.net.](http://authorize.net "‌")

If you had a manual status in mongo, you could also run a job that checks each day to see if any manual/apple or google customer descriptions changed.

We also have to think about email notifications.

You should probably store **Customer Profile ID in the mongo collect incase we need to query a specific customer from code.**

Maybe it should be in the JWT token?  If someone clicks change subscription or change credit card we need it.

So when we first launch this we will keep using Restrict Content pro as well.  If someone is using RCP you they can see all the same pages as now but all new subscriptions will come in via this new authnet credit card process.  Once a person is on authnet we will always redirect them to these new authnet pages you are building (in the main webapp).

‌

I started a project in github with the authnet api methods we need but I was just testing it.  If you want to add this to our main api or create a new typescript billing api you can.  My code is pretty simple but will help understand.  One main api method /subscribe

It seems possible to export everyone from stripe to [auth.net](http://auth.net "‌") and possibly paypal too so we will try to get rid of RCP as soon as we can.

So this API should send updates to your main subscription API that saves date in mongo just like RCP does not is my thinking :)
card.name: Create New Billing System

They take care of all the credit card stuff, customer profiles and automatic subscriptions.  We just need to add these features

1. Create new Customer/Subscription
2. Update Subscription (Yearly>Monthly or Monthy>Yearly) with prorating (we need to figure out how to pro-rate.)
3. Cancel Subscription
4. Create subscription from apple/google.
5. Cancel subscription from apple/google.
6. Expire subscription on failed payments
7. Expire subscription for all manual payments after cancellation (credit card payments this should happen automatically)

‌

So when we have credit card payments we will have subscription records but first we can just look at the customer description to see if it starts with Apple, Google, or Manual.  If it starts with one of those then they are automatically active.  If not we can look at subscription status.  Currently we are looking at the status in Mongo, maybe this is best and we just look at webhooks that update mongo.  If I can go in and just edit a customer in [authorize.net](http://authorize.net "‌") and say “expired” instead of manual, or if I cancel the subscription.  Seems best if I can just do all user managment from a[uthorize.net.](http://authorize.net "‌")

If you had a manual status in mongo, you could also run a job that checks each day to see if any manual/apple or google customer descriptions changed.

We also have to think about email notifications.
card.name: Create New Billing System

card.desc:
TD will have 2 independent environments: UAT and PROD. Local development should use local development machine.

![image.png](https://trello.com/1/cards/66733df7e439873e8ade4d42/attachments/667346aaecb496a87afa60a4/download/image.png)

‌

- All variables should be defined in .env file. Sensitive variable should have no value
- For local development, an .env.local file should be used with values used during development. This file should be added in the gitignore, so it’s never commited.
- The environment variables for PROD and UAT environments would be defined as described in this article on the prod and uat dokku server[https://dokku.com/docs/configuration/environment-variables/](https://dokku.com/docs/configuration/environment-variables/ "smartCard-inline")
- as a general rule, instead of having 3 variables like this:
  TELEGRAM\_BOT\_TOKEN_DEV=
  TELEGRAM\_BOT\_TOKEN_STAGE=
  TELEGRAM\_BOT\_TOKEN_PROD=

‌

we should have one variable, with different values depending on the environment we are building:

TELEGRAM\_BOT\_TOKEN
card.name: Standardize environment variables and remove them from .env files.

cards.desc:
So FreeRide is a Zwift term but I am going to use the same term for something in Garmin called Open Ended.  These are two different concepts but I will treat them as the same.  FreeRide in zwift means a specific amount of time but any power you want. Open-Ended in Garmin means specific power but ride as long as you want until you push the lap button on the Garmin.    By default FreeRide is 60% when we import it, if the user types 60% or uploads that amount then when we send FreeRide to Garmin I want to send the percentage 55-100% lap interval, this makes it so it's essentially any power you want also.  If the user changes it from 60% to something else then let's send that interval the normal way to Garmin but just make it open-ended.

You should test this by importing a ZWO file with <FreeRide Duration =xxxx ... and then it should have a Free Ride interval in the editor and when you save and push to Garmin and download ZWO, it should just work...

cards.desc:
Allow user to signup to Strava, read last 30 days of history when signing up. Also read last 90 days including all streams of cycling workouts that include power/watts.  Store the raw stream data in CoachBotSvc, and then after the data is loaded run metrics on it.    Then build a UI to show metrics history in hidden URL in trainerday.  

Then each day when an athlete performs a new workout, strava will send a web hook to stravasvc and stravasvc can send a notification to coachbot. Coachbot should pull the stream data and run metrics on that individual workout and then send out a notification to telegram with these latest stats and I can see the stats in the UI.  

Here is list of metrics (I am working on building in cycling-metrics library, or I am building some metrics in python that you will call rest api to get these metrics.  For example CP, wprime and wbal will come from python.



mmp - mean-max-power (web api) - called power duration curve in mockup
cp - from mmp cyclingpy (webapi)
wprime - from mmp cyclingpy (webapi)
wbal - from mmp cyclingpy (webapi) 
wbalMin - just do _.min(wbal)
tss - cycling metrics
if - cycling metrics
hrAvg - just average of strava hr stream, remove any 0s or nulls.
totalSeconds
dateTimeUTC

cards.desc:
Right now taper has no intensity.  We should let taper work the way it works now but insert some intensity up to 4 days in advance, the last 3 days before the event should not have any intensity, so that is days not workouts.

What you want to do is to find 2 workouts they did last week that had main work intervals > 100% and when  So let’s say last week was Dynamic Force #10.  Take that workout they had schedulede and cut the main work in 1/2 (or approximately 1/2) and inject it after 10 minutes into todays taper workout.  Do the same with a second workout and try to make this on the same days so if last week it was Mon and Wed for these, schedule them this week for mon and wed also as long as that is not 3 or less days from the event.   If it is just inject them into the workout that is 4 or more days from the event and a workout that is 2 or more days before this as long as both of those are taper days.

Now if they don’t have any > 100% workouts.  Just inject 3 intervals of of 120% for 1 minute with 2 minutes rest on the same days above.

It’s possible in some cases you will only get 1 of these intensity main work sections injected.
cards.name: CJ - Improve Taper

cards.desc:
So we are using [authorize.net](http://authorize.net "‌") for billing but they only allow credit card based billing but we can “hack it” so that we add our manual payments.

They take care of all the credit card stuff, customer profiles and automatic subscriptions.  We just need to add these features

1. Create new Customer/Subscription
2. Update Subscription (Yearly>Monthly or Monthy>Yearly) with prorating (we need to figure out how to pro-rate.)
3. Cancel Subscription
4. Create subscription from apple/google.
5. Cancel subscription from apple/google.
6. Expire subscription on failed payments
7. Expire subscription for all manual payments after cancellation (credit card payments this should happen automatically)

‌

So when we have credit card payments we will have subscription records but first we can just look at the customer description to see if it starts with Apple, Google, or Manual.  If it starts with one of those then they are automatically active.  If not we can look at subscription status.  Currently we are looking at the status in Mongo, maybe this is best and we just look at webhooks that update mongo.  If I can go in and just edit a customer in [authorize.net](http://authorize.net "‌") and say “expired” instead of manual, or if I cancel the subscription.  Seems best if I can just do all user managment from a[uthorize.net.](http://authorize.net "‌")

If you had a manual status in mongo, you could also run a job that checks each day to see if any manual/apple or google customer descriptions changed.

We also have to think about email notifications.

You should probably store **Customer Profile ID in the mongo collect incase we need to query a specific customer from code.**

Maybe it should be in the JWT token?  If someone clicks change subscription or change credit card we need it.

So when we first launch this we will keep using Restrict Content pro as well.  If someone is using RCP you they can see all the same pages as now but all new subscriptions will come in via this new authnet credit card process.  Once a person is on authnet we will always redirect them to these new authnet pages you are building (in the main webapp).

‌

I started a project in github with the authnet api methods we need but I was just testing it.  If you want to add this to our main api or create a new typescript billing api you can.  My code is pretty simple but will help understand.  One main api method /subscribe

It seems possible to export everyone from stripe to [auth.net](http://auth.net "‌") and possibly paypal too so we will try to get rid of RCP as soon as we can.

So this API should send updates to your main subscription API that saves date in mongo just like RCP does not is my thinking :)

cards.desc:
TD will have 2 independent environments: UAT and PROD. Local development should use local development machine.

![image.png](https://trello.com/1/cards/66733df7e439873e8ade4d42/attachments/667346aaecb496a87afa60a4/download/image.png)

‌

- All variables should be defined in .env file. Sensitive variable should have no value
- For local development, an .env.local file should be used with values used during development. This file should be added in the gitignore, so it’s never commited.
- The environment variables for PROD and UAT environments would be defined as described in this article on the prod and uat dokku server[https://dokku.com/docs/configuration/environment-variables/](https://dokku.com/docs/configuration/environment-variables/ "smartCard-inline")
- as a general rule, instead of having 3 variables like this:
  TELEGRAM\_BOT\_TOKEN_DEV=
  TELEGRAM\_BOT\_TOKEN_STAGE=
  TELEGRAM\_BOT\_TOKEN_PROD=

‌

we should have one variable, with different values depending on the environment we are building:

TELEGRAM\_BOT\_TOKEN
cards.name: Standardize environment variables and remove them from .env files.
